newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: SNB says will counter unrealistic Sfr moves.
newsitem.headline: SNB says will counter unrealistic Sfr moves.

text.p: Swiss National Bank board member Bruno Gehrig said the central bank would continue to counter "unrealistic" developments in the Swiss franc's exchange rate triggered by plans to introduce a single European currency.
"We said at our last meeting with the press that we would resist any unrealistic distortion in the exchange rate and we will continue to do this," Gehrig told the SNB's semi-annual news conference.
He said he could not forecast whether the franc would appreciate strongly on future uncertainty about plans for the third stage of European economic and monetary union.
"The uncertainty could increase or the uncertainty could decrease. We do not know any more than you," he said.

The SNB has injected extra liquidity into the money market since last month to counter any speculative rise in the franc, which has traditionally played the role of a "safe haven" currency amid EMU jitters.
